title: How to Cook Green Bananas

steps.headline: Cut the ends of the bananas.
Make two cuts along the length of the banana, on opposite sides.
steps.description: The cut should only go as deep as the skin. Do not remove the skins.

steps.headline: Place the bananas in boiling water and cover for 15 minutes.
Drain the water and peel the bananas.
In the same pot, place 8 cups of water and 2 tbsp of salt and bring to a boil.
Place the bananas in the boiling water and cover them.
Add 1 cup of cold water and boil for another 5 minutes.
Drain and let the bananas cool.
Cut into one-inch slices and place them into a glass or porcelain container.
Place garlic, sweet peppers and peppercorns into a mortar and crush with a pestle.
steps.description: If you don't have a mortar and pestle, give them a few pulses in a food processor or blender.

steps.headline: Add olive oil, lime juice, vinegar and 1 tsp of salt.
Add the sauce to the green bananas and toss to mix well.

tyn: Pots to boil water and bananas
Glass or porcelain bowl for serving
Mortar and pestle, food processor, or blender
text: Cut the ends of the bananas.  Make two cuts along the length of the banana, on opposite sides. The cut should only go as deep as the skin. Do not remove the skins. Place the bananas in boiling water and cover for 15 minutes.  Drain the water and peel the bananas.  In the same pot, place 8 cups of water and 2 tbsp of salt and bring to a boil.  Place the bananas in the boiling water and cover them.  Boil gently for 10 minutes.  Add 1 cup of cold water and boil for another 5 minutes.  Drain and let the bananas cool.  Cut into one-inch slices and place them into a glass or porcelain container.  Place garlic, sweet peppers and peppercorns into a mortar and crush with a pestle. If you don't have a mortar and pestle, give them a few pulses in a food processor or blender. Add olive oil, lime juice, vinegar and 1 tsp of salt. Mix well. Add the sauce to the green bananas and toss to mix well.  Serve promptly with cocktail toothpicks.

Drain and let the bananas cool.
Cut into one-inch slices and place them into a glass or porcelain container.
Place garlic, sweet peppers and peppercorns into a mortar and crush with a pestle.
If you don't have a mortar and pestle, give them a few pulses in a food processor or blender.
Add olive oil, lime juice, vinegar and 1 tsp of salt.
Add the sauce to the green bananas and toss to mix well.
